All Classes

Class
Description
ActionTracker
ActionTracker class tracks changes between which keys are currently being pressed implements Singleton design pattern to ensure single instance of object exists and to share one reference
Controller
The Controller classes connects the game by having direct communication to the model and the view.
CreateEnemyMessage
The CreateEnemyMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to create an enemy
CreateProjectileMessage
The CreateProjectileMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to create a projectile
Enemy
Enemy class that inherits from Entity has all basic methods and fields (position, velocity, etc.)
Entity
abstract class inherited by all game objects, stores data about position, velocity, activity, collision defines common methods for updating position, activity, collision, and checking for collision
FirstScreenMessage
The FirstScreenMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to first load the start screen
GameInfo
The GameInfo class contains the data from the model class that we want to bring to the View package.
GameOverPanel
GameOverPanel class that inherits from JPanel to define the layout of the GameOver screen To be added to the main JFrame and create messages to transition/switch to other screens
GamePanel
GamePanel class that inherits from JPanel defines layout of active game screen(when playing is in progress) and handles drawing and updating of components (player, enemies, projectiles) handles key inputs and button presses, regularly creates messages to animate movement
Item
Item class that inherits from Entity has all basic methods and fields (position, velocity, etc.)
Message
The Message interface is the form of communication in the MVC architecture.
Model
Model class: stores all game data - entities, positions, scores, game states, etc.
ModelTester
 
NewGameMessage
The NewGameMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to start initializing the game objects/data and the player
PewGame
 
Player
Player class that inherits from Entity has all basic methods and fields (position, velocity, etc.)
PlayerTester
 
Projectile
Projectile class inheriting from Entity has all basic methods and fields (position, velocity, etc.)
SpriteData
contains all sprite data(buffered images), passes them to the view for drawing
StartGameMessage
The StartGameMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to switch to the game screen
StartPanel
StartPanel that inherits from JPanel Defines the layout of the start screen, uses action listeners to create messages for switching screens To be added to main JFrame
UpdateEntitiesMessage
The UpdateEntitiesMessage class is a message passed to the controller which tells the game to update the positions and behavior of all the entities present in the game.
Valve
The Valve interface is implemented by all the inner classes in the Controller class in order to execute their respective functions depending on the Message object passed
ValveResponse
The types of responses of a Valve
View
Main View class that handles switching between different screens(sub-panels) and passing GameInfo to sub-panels
